issue.title: Text in GUI Very Small and Almost Unreadable on Windows
issue.body:
Hi. I downloaded the latest Win 64 build (v 23.0) during the Testing Review Club Meeting. When I installed it, I found the text in the Welcome Window and on the download progress screen was very small, and almost unreadable. 

I am running a 15.6" laptop resolution 1366 x 768 and 32" inch external monitor resolution 3840 x 2160, and the text size was extremely small on both.

events.body:

Have you tried running bitcoin core without being connected to the display in order to test if its a OS level scaling issue or an issue with the gui?

@hebasto

@svav 

Hmm, I can see some inconsistency between your hardware and logs.

Hardware consists of 2 monitors:
> I am running a 15.6" laptop resolution 1366 x 768 and 32" inch external monitor resolution 3840 x 2160, and the text size was extremely small on both.

but only one monitor has been mentioned in the log:
> 2022-04-01T14:56:15Z Screen: \.\DISPLAY1 1366x768, pixel ratio=1.0

Any idea what could be the reason of such inconsistency?

@hebasto 

Well, it does look like Bitcoin Core is not able to detect that I am running an external monitor in this case. I haven't had any problems with other programs, so it looks like its just Bitcoin Core that can't detect the Windows Monitor information. I don't know how the text size is calculated, but whilst it's not recognising the external display, it's clearly recognising something about my setup that is then making the text too small. I'm thinking it's some sort of ratio / proportionality issue.  I will have to leave it to the experts.

I'd say it is Qt framework's issue.
